org.dellroad.stuff.vaadin22.data

Class AsyncDataProvider<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vaadin.flow.data.provider.AbstractDataProvider<T,SerializablePredicate<T>>
      • com.vaadin.flow.data.provider.ListDataProvider<T>
        • org.dellroad.stuff.vaadin22.data.AsyncDataProvider<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - data provider model type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConfigurableFilterDataProvider<T,SerializablePredicate<T>,SerializablePredicate<T>>, DataProvider<T,SerializablePredicate<T>>, InMemoryDataProvider<T>, Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    VaadinSessionDataProvider

    public class AsyncDataProvider<T>
extends ListDataProvider<T>
    A ListDataProvider that supports asynchronous loading.

    Instances are just a ListDataProvider with an added ability to load the underlying data list using the results from an asynchronous background query. These async load attempts are initiated via load() and may be canceled in progress via cancel().

    Any AsyncDataProvider.LoadListeners receive status updates when a load operation starts, completes, fails, or is canceled. These updates can be used to drive GUI loading spinners, etc. The isBusy() method can be used at any time to determine if there is any load operation in progress.

    This class handles all required synchronization and locking. It guarantees that at most one async load task can be happening at a time, that listener notifications are delivered in proper order, and that instance's state can not change unexpectely (i.e., there are no race conditions) as long as the current VaadinSession remains locked whenever instances are accessed. Put another way, everything that occurs while the session is locked appears to happen atomically.

    Instances bind to the current VaadinSession at construction time and may only be used with that session.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getVaadinSession

        public VaadinSession getVaadinSession()
        Get the VaadinSession to which this instance data provider belongs.
        Returns:
        this instance's VaadinSession, never null

      • setAsyncExecutor

        public void setAsyncExecutor(Function<? super Runnable,? extends Future<?>> executor)
        Configure the executor used for async tasks.
        Parameters:
        executor - the thing that launches background tasks

      • load

        public long load(AsyncDataProvider.Loader<? extends T> loader)
        Trigger a new asynchronous load of this instance.

        If there is already an async load in progress, this method will cancel() it first. You can check this ahead of time via isBusy().

        If/when the given load task completes, its results will completely replace the contents of this data provider.

        Parameters:
        loader - performs the load operation
        Returns:
        unique ID for this load attempt
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the current thread is not associated with this instance's session
        IllegalStateException - if there is no executor configured
        IllegalArgumentException - if either parameter is null

      • isBusy

        public boolean isBusy()
        Determine whether there is an outstanding async load operation.
        Returns:
        true if an async load operation is active, otherwise false
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the current thread is not associated with this instance's session

      • cancel

        public long cancel()
        Attempt to cancel the current outstanding async load operation, if any.

        Note: this may result in interrupting the async thread.

        If this method returns non-zero, it is guaranteed that the results of the corresponding load attempt are not applied.

        Returns:
        the unique ID of the canceled load attempt, if any, otherwise zero
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the current thread is not associated with this instance's session

      • addLoadListener

        public Registration addLoadListener(AsyncDataProvider.LoadListener listener)
        Add a AsyncDataProvider.LoadListener to this instance.
        Parameters:
        listener -
        Returns:
        listener registration
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if listener is null
        IllegalStateException - if the current thread is not associated with this instance's session

      • nextTaskId

        protected long nextTaskId()
        Get the next unique task ID.
        Returns:
        unique task ID, never zero

      • notifyListeners

        protected void notifyListeners(long id,
                               int status,
                               Throwable error)
        Notify listeners (later).
        Parameters:
        id - task ID
        status - task status
        error - task error or null
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the current thread is not associated with this instance's session

      • performLoad

        protected void performLoad(long id,
                           AsyncDataProvider.Loader<? extends T> loader)
        Perform the load operation.

        This is invoked in the async background thread.

        When done, this method should invoke applyLoad() with this instance's session locked.

        Parameters:
        id - task ID
        loader - load callback
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if id is zero
        IllegalArgumentException - if loader is null

      • applyLoad

        protected void applyLoad(long id,
                         Throwable error,
                         Stream<? extends T> stream)
        Apply the outcome of a load operation in whatever way is appropriate.

        This is invoked with this instance's session locked.

        Parameters:
        id - task ID
        error - load error, or null if there was no error
        stream - load results, or null if there was an error
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the current thread is not associated with this instance's session
        IllegalArgumentException - if id is zero
        IllegalArgumentException - if stream is null

      • updateFromLoad

        protected void updateFromLoad(long id,
                              Stream<? extends T> stream)
        Update this data provider's internal list of items using the new data from a successful load operation and fire a refresh notification.

        This is invoked with this instance's session locked.

        Parameters:
        id - task ID
        stream - load results
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the current thread is not associated with this instance's session
        IllegalArgumentException - if stream is null

      • handleLoaderException

        protected void handleLoaderException(long id,
                                     Throwable t)
        Invoked when an exception is thrown by the AsyncDataProvider.Loader.

        This method runs in the background thread and the VaadinSession will not be locked.

        The implementation in AsyncDataProvider just logs an error.

        Parameters:
        id - the unique ID of the load attempt that failed
        t - the exception that was caught
